channel.title: Recent posts to TestCases for Variable-length integer handling
channel.description: Recent posts to TestCases for Variable-length integer handling

item.title: TestCases for Variable-length integer handling
item.description:
Thanks. I have only now looked at these in detail, after so many months. :-( Sorry.

There are some problems:

  • Use of srand() and rand() makes the tests non-deterministic and thus harder to reproduce if they happened to catch something.

  • Return values of some lzma_vli_??code() calls aren't checked.

  • Using the macros like expect() from tests.h would give better debug info if a test fails.

  • Multiple tiny issues like comparison between signed and unsigned.

Unfortunately I cannot accept these as is and I'm not able to work on them myself either for now.
item.dc:creator: Lasse Collin

item.title: TestCases for Variable-length integer handling
item.description:
Also, the Makefile.am in directory tests show add these cases.Add test_vli_size and test_vli_coder into parameters [TESTS and check_PROGRAMS].

And in the root directory of source code, run ./configure command to update Makefile.
item.dc:creator: Bruce Stark
